title: Two Objects connected by a string over a pulley

content.question: Two objects of mass <math alttext="M sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="M sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> are connected by a string that passes over a pulley with negligible mass and negligible friction, as shown. A group of students wants to use this setup to measure the acceleration due to gravity <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>g</mi></math>. Which of the following procedures could the students use?

choices.label: Use equal masses, collect velocity data for <math alttext="M sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and calculate its acceleration.
Use equal masses, collect position data for <math alttext="M sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and calculate its average velocity.
Use unequal masses, collect velocity data for <math alttext="M sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and calculate its acceleration.
Use unequal masses, collect position data for <math alttext="M sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and calculate its average velocity.

Use different sets of equal masses, collect velocity data for each value of <math alttext="M sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and calculate the average acceleration.

content.answer: Use unequal masses, collect velocity data for <math alttext="M sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and calculate its acceleration.
